definition: (of animals, the wind etc) to make a mournful sound/whine/moan/wail
sorrow/grief/pity/to grieve for/to pity/to lament/to condole
Ai (c. 2000 BC), sixth of legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Li 釐|厘[Li2]
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)

sentences.english: The colony whines in a centerless loud drone that vibrates the neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 蜂群嗡嗡喧闹的哀鸣振动邻里。

sentences.english: The class groaned as the teacher handed out the tests.
sentences.chinese: 老师发试卷的时候全班哀鸣。

sentences.english: With a sound of groaning metal, the chassis eased upward a few inches.
sentences.chinese: 随着一声金属的哀鸣声，底盘向上送动了几英寸。

sentences.english: There is something undeniably soulful about the eerie whine of the highland bagpipes.
sentences.chinese: 高原风笛神秘的哀鸣有着让人无法抗拒的深情。

sentences.english: Until they got bored with its bleating and slaughtered it for supper.
sentences.chinese: 直到他们厌倦了它的哀鸣然后宰了它做成晚餐。

sentences.english: Ambulance sirens were heard in many parts of Phnom Penh soon after the accident.
sentences.chinese: 事故发生后，金边多处都可听到警报器的哀鸣声。

sentences.english: We heard the dog whine last night.
sentences.chinese: 我们昨夜听到狗在哀鸣。

sentences.english: No wonder Wall Street is whining.
Have you ever smelled birds in the despair at gunpoint moan?
sentences.chinese: 您可曾闻到鸟儿在枪口下绝望的哀鸣？

sentences.english: In the yard outside, his budgerigars rattle at their rusty cages.
sentences.chinese: 庭院里，他的虎皮鹦鹉在锈迹斑斑的笼中嘎嘎哀鸣。

sentences.english: The crickets chirred plaintively at the foot of the wall.
Pitch-coated rope groans against the pull of the gears.
sentences.chinese: 涂上沥青的绳索对抗机械的拉扯哀鸣。

definition: to cry piteously/anguished wailing/same as 哀嚎
to whinny (of a horse)/to neigh/to shout
to howl in grief/anguished wailing/same as 哀号
to emit a sound/(of birds, insects etc) to chirp, hoot etc/(of a siren, steam whistle etc) to sound
